network¶

network module.

Functions related networks, routers, network connectors, vpn etc are here.
k5lib.network.connect_network_connector_endpoint(project_token, region, endpoint_id, port_id)¶

Connect networkc connector with endpoint.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 region name.
  • endpoint_id – Endpoint ID.
  • port_id – Port ID.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull operation. Otherwise error code from requests library.
k5lib.network.create_inter_project_connection(project_token, region, router_id, port_id)¶

Add an interface from a subnet in a different project to the router in the project.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token.
  • region – Region of target project
  • router_id – ID of the router at target project
  • port_id – ID of port at source project
Returns:

ID of inter project connection if succesfull. Otherwise error code from requests library.

Create a network into project.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token.
  • region – Region
  • az – AZ for example fi-1a
  • network_name – Name of the network.
Returns:

ID of network if suucesfull, otherwise error from requests lib

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • project_id – K5 project ID
  • region – K5 region name.
  • connector_name – Connector name.
Returns:

k5lib.network.create_network_connector_endpoint(project_token, project_id, region, az, endpoint_name, networkconnector_id)¶

Create a endpoint into specified network connector.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token.
  • project_id – Valid K5 project ID
  • region – K5 region name.
  • az – K5 availability zone name.
  • endpoint_name – Name of endpoint
  • networkconnector_id – network connector ID
Returns:

ID of connector if succesfull. Otherwise error code from requests library.
k5lib.network.create_port_on_network(project_token, region, az, port_name, securitygroup_id, network_id, subnet_id=None, ip_address=None)¶

Create a port on network.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 region name.
  • az – K5 availability zone name.
  • port_name – Port name.
  • securitygroup_id – Security group ID.
  • network_id – Network ID.
  • subnet_id – Subnet ID.
  • ip_address – IP address for the port.
Returns:

JSON if succesfull. Otherwise error code from requests library.
k5lib.network.create_router(project_token, region, name=None, az=None, admin_state_up=None)¶

Create router.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 Region eg ‘fi-1’
  • name – Name of the router.
  • az – AZ name eg f1-1a.
  • admin_state_up – The administrative state of the router, which is up (true) or down (false).
Returns:

Router ID if succesfull, otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.network.create_security_group(project_token, region, name, description)¶

Create a security group.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 Region eg ‘fi-1’
  • name – Name of security group
  • description – Description for security group.
Returns:

Security group ID if succesfull, otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.network.create_security_group_rule(project_token, region, security_group_id, direction, ethertype='IPv4', protocol=None, port_range_min=None, port_range_max=None, remote_ip_prefix=None, remote_group_id=None)¶

Create security group rule.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 Region eg ‘fi-1’
  • security_group_id – ID of the security group.
  • direction – Ingress or egress: The direction in which the security group rule is applied. For a compute instance, an ingress security group rule is applied to incoming (ingress) traffic for that instance. An egress rule is applied to traffic leaving the instance.
  • ethertype – Must be IPv4, and addresses represented in CIDR must match the ingress or egress rules. If this values is not specified, IPv4 is set.
  • protocol – The protocol that is matched by the security group rule. Valid values are null, tcp, udp, icmp, and digits between 0-and 255.
  • port_range_min – The minimum port number in the range that is matched by the security group rule. When the protocol is TCP or UDP, this value must be less than or equal to the value of the port_range_max attribute. If this value is not specified, the security group rule matches all numbers of port. If port_range_min is 0, all port numbers are allowed regardless of port_range_max. When the protocol is ICMP, this value must be an ICMP type. If this value is not specified, the security group rule matches all ICMP types.
  • port_range_max – The maximum port number in the range that is matched by the security group rule. When the protocol is TCP or UDP , the port_range_min attribute constrains the port_range_max attribute. When the protocol is ICMP, this value must be an ICMP code. If this value is not specified, the security group rule matches all ICMP codes.
  • remote_ip_prefix – The remote IP prefix to be associated with this security group rule. You can specify either remote_group_id or remote_ip_prefix in the request body. This attribute matches the specified IP prefix as the source or destination IP address of the IP packet. If direction is ingress matches source, otherwise matches destination.
  • remote_group_id – The remote group ID to be associated with this security group rule. You can specify either remote_group_id or remote_ip_prefix.
Returns:

Security group ID if succesfull, otherwise error from request library.
k5lib.network.create_subnet(project_token, region, network_id, cidr, subnet_name='subnet', version='4', az=None, allocation_pools=None, dns_nameservers=None, host_routes=None, gateway_ip=None)¶

Create a subnet.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 Region eg ‘fi-1’
  • network_id – ID for network
  • cidr – (string). For example:‘192.168.199.0/24’
  • subnet_name – (optional) Name of the subnet, eg ‘subnet’
  • version – IP version ‘4’ or ‘6’
  • az – AZ name eg f1-1a
  • allocation_pools – (optional) (Dict) The start and end addresses for the allocation pools.
  • dns_nameservers – (optional) A list of DNS name servers for the subnet. For example: [“8.8.8.7”, “8.8.8.8”]. The specified IP addresses are displayed in sorted order in ascending order. The lowest IP address will be the primary DNS address.
  • host_routes –

    (optional) A list of host route dictionaries for the subnet. For example: “host_routes”:[

    { “destination”:”0.0.0.0/0”, “nexthop”:”172.16.1.254”
    },

    { “destination”:”192.168.0.0/24”, “nexthop”:”192.168.0.1” }

    ]

  • gateway_ip – (optional)
Returns:

Subnet ID if succesfull, otherwise error from request library
k5lib.network.delete_inter_project_connection(project_token, region, router_id, port_id)¶

Delete an interface from a subnet in a different project to the router in the project.

Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token.
  • region – Region of target project.
  • router_id – ID of the router at target project.
  • port_id – ID of port at source project.
Returns:

ID of inter project connection if succesfull. Otherwise error code from requests library.

k5lib.network.update_inter_project_connection(project_token, region, router_id, routes)¶
Update the routing information between different tenants within the same domain.
Parameters:
  • project_token – A valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 region name
  • router_id – Router ID.
  • routes –

    List of dictionaries in format: {“nexthop”:”IPADDRESS”,

    “destination”:”CIDR”}
Returns:

ID of connection if succesfull. Otherwise error from requests library.
k5lib.network.update_router(project_token, region, router_id, name=None, az=None, admin_state_up=None, network_id=None, route_table=None)¶

Update router.

Parameters:
  • project_token – Valid K5 project token
  • region – K5 Region eg ‘fi-1’
  • router_id – ID of the router
  • name – Name of the router.
  • az – AZ name eg f1-1a.
  • admin_state_up – The administrative state of the router, which is up (true) or down (false).
  • network_id – ID of external network.
  • route_table –
    “nexthop”:”10.1.0.10”, “destination”:”40.0.1.0/24”
Returns:

JSON if succesfull otherwise error from reguests library.
